intro: Carex klaphakei, commonly known as Klaphake's sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of flowers during the summer months. It is often found in rocky or coastal areas, adapting well to poor soil conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
